instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.PP3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is PP3V3_S0SW_LCD? PP3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail necessary to power the image circuitry on the screen. This is necessary to get a picture on the screen. .
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi guys.

I have this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> powering on and I get only backlight. No liquid, no burned parts, and no shorted lines on the LCD circuit. I noticed on the <SIGNAL>EDP_INT</SIGNAL> lines I have only 0.4v, how much it should have? I haven't tried another LCD, waiting for new stock of those models lcd. I have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> 3v, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> 5v... 

I suspect <CHIP>U9850</CHIP>, but before i go ahead and change it, any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Test with known good LCD assembly first.
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/8 models should serve for test.

Did you check USB activity and external video?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I just received a new LCD, and it shows an image with it. Maybe an LCD flex cable issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
A problem with any video flex from display assembly, should still show image; with stripes, flickering lines.
The problem can be on the T-CON board, or LCD itself.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Yes, i thought so after checking the flex and it's all good. I'll offer a new LCD :) Thank you very much
